description: MAQ Software delivers innovative software applications for Fortune 500 companies to increase their productivity. Founded in 2000, the company employs over 500 people in three engineering centers located in Redmond, WA and India. 828.sentence_text: I was working in Mumbai Office for four months. And I cant forget those four months entire my life. Each day I regret why I am going office. There is nothing I can say is positive. But you cane get following things as positive if you think only about your career no personal life at all. Your endurance level and patience level increased so many folds. This is the only experience I get from MAQ. Huge  …   work responsibility. Work on so many things parallelly. More working hours even you can work on the weekend also, they do not bother at all. Whatever be your position and experience you have to clear six months BootCamp courses. For the BootCamp you have to come on Saturday which is compulsory and if you skipped, considered as a leave and salary will be deducted. You have to do so many certifications without your interest. Managers sit beside you and clear your coding standard test because they have to show data of 90% pass marks. Monthly celebrations but the budget fixed if it increased Project Manager come to your desk for extra expenses. Show More

771.sentence_text: Oh god thats a huge list 1. They have got no good projects. 2. Hikes are not for people who work hard, but for people who constantly please their manager and team leads not by work but by other means. 3. You will be forced to come as early as 8:45 AM and if you fail to do it, your manager will threaten you openely about your next salary hike. 4. If your relationship with your team lead is good, you are  …   safe and you will get good ratings, even if you are too bad at your work. On the other hand if you are talented and have a little self esteem and doesn't want to please people with other means, you are totally not safe. I have seen cases where a female? employee gets constant hikes and promotions because she lets her manager do inappropriate things with her during and after office. 5. They will check your intime and outtime, if they found that you are giving only 8 to 9 hours daily in company which is more than what we are paid for, your manager will ask you if you have less work or in some cases may even fire you. The expectation is that you must never work less than 13-15 hours. 6. No respect for female employees. They can ask you to work till 12 in the night and then nobody cares how you are going home. Ladies living with families can manage this situation somehow, but what about the single women living alone. For them its a real problem. I have seen some female employees staying in office till morning due to this. 7. You will be made to complete certification based on which they ask Microsoft for projects. But you have to pay yourself for these costly certificates and if you pass you will get reimbursed else your money went in vain. There is no value of these certificates outside this company. 8. You will be called to work on Saturdays based on project needs and you will not be paid anything for that day. 9. No job security. Seen too my cases of premature contract termination and even permanent full time offers get terminated. Seen few cases like people from NITs and IITs are getting fired within just 4-5 months of employment just because they were new in projects and there was a need to cut down budget. 10. DO NOT JOIN THIS COMPANY. If you do not want to ruin your future. They may show you attractive salary structure but that's all fake. They need contract workers for few months so they attract people with salaries and fire them later. They dont even give any notice or compensation on firing. 11. Last advice to all the people who are about to join this company. PLEASE DON'T?. They must have offered good packages at NITs and IITs but seriously do not fall for it. That's just a trap. People from good colleges trust me, you do not want this black spot on your career. Show More

484.sentence_text: This review is specific to the MBA hires at MAQ, as they were not covered in detail in existing reviews, however might be useful for others as well. One might consider this profile if they have 2-6 years of development experience and are in the final year of MBA. I will give a few stats that will help you decide and a few recommendations. 1. Retention numbers (For Project Managers (PM) and Associate PM (APM)  …   combined) MBA recruits in 2012 ~ 17, still in company =2 MBA recruits in 2013 ~ 17, still in company =3 MBA recruits in 2014 ~ 16, still in company =8 This is a direct outcome of the company’s “Use and Throw” policy. They have already understood that the attrition will be high due to the culture and implementation style of upper management. As a solution, they hire in bulk and by the time hires realize, search a job and leave, the next batch is ready to come in. Hence, they ‘really’ do not care whether you stay or leave (This is a quote from a higher up person, managing most of the Hyderabad office) People who are staying are either not getting opportunities or have location constraints. Few recruits have even resigned in the first week, one on the first day itself. 2. Experienced engineers (3+) years in India office can be counted on fingers and are staying in company because of the same reasons as in 1. 3. Since most of the engineers are less than 2 years of experience, the focus of the Project Management is to babysit the team and get them to work late nights and weekends with you being present. The learning curve is very flat, and will comprise of “mandatory” coding certifications on own time (read Saturdays). Under the cloak of You should know technical so that you can manage team well you will be made to do technical work. If you can’t code, you will need to test. Note that there is no QA team so if you do not code, you will be the assigned tester for all implementations. 4. As per Organization structure, Associate PM role is equivalent to Tech Lead (not Sr. Tech Lead), so the “Manager” in the title is a misnomer for luring in MBA grads. Continued employment in IT, without MBA, would have gotten you a better profile with a lesser title though. For the past 3-4 four years’ hires, not a single Associate Project Manager has been promoted to Project Manager in spite of hiring close to 30 Associate Project managers. 5. Multiple instances of people being fired if they are 5 minutes late to meetings. Agreed that being on time is very important, but firing effective immediately goes too far (FYI: I was not fired) 6. For first six months, one will have mandatory Saturdays and will need to clear 3 technical certifications. All the “fun” and learning activities are scheduled on Sundays (Saturdays if span of two days, expect 7-8 Saturdays working and 3-4 weekends every year where you will work 13 days straight. Promotions and raises are directly linked to attending these events and doing technical certifications. 7. Office starts at 8:30 AM and leaves are cut if you are late by one minute. 12-14 hours in office is a norm (see point 3) and an insight into the culture can be derived from the fact that people start clapping if you leave at 6 or so. 8. Bi Annual Salary reviews will only happen after 3 cycles, so you can expect a salary raise after 18+ months of joining. The base salary is rarely increased though, you will be given a bonus (not fixed and not known before hand), so it is difficult to negotiate during job interviews. Most companies I interacted with weren’t ready to factor in the bonus component, so it’s difficult to get a raise. 9. Onsite opportunities are negligible and limited to one week, max two on B1 visa. Recently the MBA grads (one with 5 years experience in MAQ and another with 2 years in MAQ) sent on deputation are given “Programmer Analyst” profiles when sent on H1B, this is exactly same profile given to 2-3 years experienced Programmers. 10. The onsite team is comprised mainly of engineers who have completed 2-3 years, so your day to day will be spent handling people who are inept to be an onsite Technical Project Manager. They are simply kids who can’t say no to customer and have their performance reviews driven by the number of escalations sent by them to India Management. There was an escalation that the team missed something six months back, and guess when it was: right before US appraisal cycle. Another set of babysitting requirements ? 11. This is an out and out family run business (see the management team on MAQ website), so issues like 5 above and other unprofessional things are very common. For the recommendation part, unless you are devoted to coding and want to get back to technical aspect, I would not advise working at this organization. If you do, be clear that it will take tat least two years (usually more) to move from PM to SPM. The movement from APM to PM is very stagnant. There is no clear role defined further than SPM, so probably they will end up adding more prefixes and call it a promotion (this is what happened with SPM role introduced this year for 2012 pass outs). They accept the fact that only 15%, or less, of hires will stay after an year, also the technical work that you will do in first 12 months will compensate for very high attrition in Engineers (read as the use and throw policy described initially). In case you are joining this company due to lack of options, my recommendation is you start looking for jobs “before” you join because you might think “how bad can it be?” but the reality will still be worse than that. Additionally, the culture of being in the office for 14 hours and Saturdays for the sake of being in office is going to take a toll and might impede job search. Show More

790.sentence_text: -> They have a huge flaw in their CTC breakdown. They would include unnecessary allowances to increase your CTC, which you won't not get until you invest in them. -> Unprofessional HR. -> They don't value their employees. You would be working like slaves and you still won't be getting any recognition for your work (including Appraisal). -> Your AVERAGE working hour would be 12-13 hours or even  …   more. -> They claim that you would learn a lot that too new technologies. But that's not true. You would have repeated work with same old technologies. -> Lots of politics. I don't think so there is any manager there who is not involved in favoring someone. -> They are not at all fair. You can't expect them to be honest towards your work recognition. They can introduce any new policy if they want. You can't expect logic in their course of action. For ex- they termed bonus(certification) as your appraisal and hence, maximum employees didn't receive appraisal(in their in-hand salary) last year. -> They don't have Sales division. They proudly promote that they get their projects from word of mouth. But now since their clients are taking away the projects assigned to them. They have no way to get new ones. -> No job security...They can fire you any time irrespective of your performance or your project requirements. It may depend on your friendly terms with your supervisor. -> They don't have stringent HR policies. No person to go to if you have problem with any of your supervisor, specially for women. -> Despite of working late in office (till 2-3 am), you are supposed to get back to office on time next day i.e. 8:45 am. I have seen my colleagues who worked for 2 constant days (48 hours) without sleeping. Even after that, you won't getting any break the next day. -> The worst part is how they fire their employees. They don't give you any notice. You are sitting in the office and working on project and next thing you know is HR calls you and informs you that today is your last working day. You are fired because of your poor performance. The irony is I know a colleague who was fired the same day when he/she received STAR OF THE MONTH award. -> You will be forced to spend on certifications(in tens of thousands) despite of your financial condition. They say that they would reimburse. But god forbid if you are unable to pass which is common, as those certifications are tough or may be if you get fired before appearing the exam...considering they can fire you anytime they want, your money is gone. -> They are not at all flexible. If you have any problem with the company policies, they won't try to address it rather they would ask you to leave the company. (CEO himself did this) Show More

798.sentence_text: - Top management hides its failures and incompetency by firing people who do actual work. - Work culture and job security does not exist in the dictionary of MAQ. - Notice period is as short as 50 minutes. You get a ping on Skype, bang, you are jobless. - Mandatory Saturdays for 6 months, which often extend to 8-9 month. - The work is often repetitive across projects. - CEO openly admits that if you  …   want comfort, find another job.No wonder, after 15+ years, there are less than 500 employees. - They keep a strict eye on in-time, while completely forgetting about out-time -People, who are good with their oral skills often lead the real talent, that too in an abusive manner. To your extreme surprise, a networking fellow will lead a team of C# developers. -Gloomy atmosphere, too much negativity in the air ,it will squeeze the happiness out of you. -Diminutive office, packed like a closet in a single floor.
